TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TransitionSet extends Android.Transitions.Transition

Docs.summary: A TransitionSet is a parent of child transitions (including other TransitionSets).

remarks.para: A TransitionSet is a parent of child transitions (including other TransitionSets). Using TransitionSets enables more complex choreography of transitions, where some sets play and others play . For example, uses a TransitionSet to sequentially play a Fade(Fade.OUT), followed by a , followed by a Fade(Fade.OUT) transition.

A TransitionSet can be described in a resource file by using the tag transitionSet, along with the standard attributes of and . Child transitions of the TransitionSet object can be loaded by adding those child tags inside the enclosing transitionSet tag. For example, the following xml describes a TransitionSet that plays a Fade and then a ChangeBounds transition on the affected view targets:

remarks.para: Constructs an empty transition set. Add child transitions to the set by calling )}. By default, child transitions will play .

Docs.param: A containing a Java Native Interface (JNI) object reference.
Docs.summary: A constructor used when creating managed representations of JNI objects; called by the runtime.

remarks.para: This constructor is invoked by the runtime infrastructure () to create a new managed representation for a Java Native Interface object.
The constructor will initializes the property of the new instance using and .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Transitions.TransitionSet AddTransition(class Android.Transitions.Transition transition) cil managed

Docs.param: A non-null child transition to be added to this set.
Docs.summary: Adds child transition to this set.

remarks.para: Adds child transition to this set. The order in which this child transition is added relative to other child transitions that are added, in addition to the property, determines the order in which the transitions are started.
If this transitionSet has a set on it, the child transition will inherit that duration. Transitions are assumed to have a maximum of one transitionSet parent.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void CaptureEndValues(class Android.Transitions.TransitionValues transitionValues) cil managed

Docs.param: The holder for any values that the Transition wishes to store. Values are stored in the values field of this TransitionValues object and are keyed from a String value. For example, to store a view's rotation value, a transition might call transitionValues.values.put("appname:transitionname:rotation", view.getRotation()). The target view will already be stored in the transitionValues structure when this method is called.
Docs.summary: Captures the values in the end scene for the properties that this transition monitors.

remarks.para:
Captures the values in the end scene for the properties that this transition monitors. These values are then passed as the endValues structure in a later call to . The main concern for an implementation is what the properties are that the transition cares about and what the values are for all of those properties. The start and end values will be compared later during the
method to determine what, if any, animations, should be run.
Subclasses must implement this method. The method should only be called by the transition system; it is not intended to be called from external classes.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void CaptureStartValues(class Android.Transitions.TransitionValues transitionValues) cil managed

Docs.param: The holder for any values that the Transition wishes to store. Values are stored in the values field of this TransitionValues object and are keyed from a String value. For example, to store a view's rotation value, a transition might call transitionValues.values.put("appname:transitionname:rotation", view.getRotation()). The target view will already be stored in the transitionValues structure when this method is called.
Docs.summary: Captures the values in the start scene for the properties that this transition monitors.

remarks.para:
Captures the values in the start scene for the properties that this transition monitors. These values are then passed as the startValues structure in a later call to . The main concern for an implementation is what the properties are that the transition cares about and what the values are for all of those properties. The start and end values will be compared later during the
method to determine what, if any, animations, should be run.
Subclasses must implement this method. The method should only be called by the transition system; it is not intended to be called from external classes.

Docs.summary: Returns the ordering of this TransitionSet.

remarks.para: Returns the ordering of this TransitionSet. By default, the value is .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Transitions.TransitionOrdering OrderingSequential = (1)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Transitions.TransitionOrdering enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: A flag used to indicate that the child transitions of this set should play in sequence; when one child transition ends, the next child transition begins.

remarks.para: A flag used to indicate that the child transitions of this set should play in sequence; when one child transition ends, the next child transition begins. Note that a transition does not end until all instances of it (which are playing on all applicable targets of the transition) end.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Transitions.TransitionOrdering OrderingTogether = (0)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Transitions.TransitionOrdering enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: A flag used to indicate that the child transitions of this set should all start at the same time.

remarks.para: A flag used to indicate that the child transitions of this set should all start at the same time.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Transitions.TransitionSet RemoveTransition(class Android.Transitions.Transition transition) cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes the specified child transition from this set.

remarks.para: Removes the specified child transition from this set.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Transitions.TransitionSet SetOrdering(valuetype Android.Transitions.TransitionOrdering ordering) cil managed

Docs.param: to play this set's child transitions together, to play the child transitions in sequence.
Docs.summary: Sets the play order of this set's child transitions.

remarks.para: Sets the play order of this set's child transitions.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
